meanings.definition: A hard, strong, gray or bluish-gray alloy of iron with carbon and usually other elements, used extensively as a structural and fabricating material.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers used steel beams to build the tall skyscraper.
meanings.sent2: The knife was made of sharp steel that could cut through anything.
meanings.sent3: The steel ruler tried to measure up to the expectations but fell short.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as strong as steel, unwavering in the face of challenges.
meanings.sent5: The steel armor gleamed under the bright sun, a symbol of strength and protection.

meanings.definition: A thing or things made of this metal.
meanings.sent1: The gate was reinforced with steel to make it more secure.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate steel jewelry displayed in the store.
meanings.sent3: The steel chair complained about being too rigid and inflexible.
meanings.sent4: His willpower was as unyielding as steel, refusing to give up.
meanings.sent5: The steel bridge spanned across the river, connecting the two sides seamlessly.
